content: 12 tails from the earlier co and bobble sts using a darning needle start on the right side where the yarn tail is at the top flap pick up gutter after the first st and before the last st palm pick up gutter before the first st and after the last st the right seam of the flap will be worked from the top down to the co edge the left seam of the flap will be worked bottom up from the co edge use the removable stitch markers you placed earlier as a guideline for starting and stopping be sure to reinforce the point where the bottom edge of the flap joins the hand as this will see much use throughout the life of the mitt make some duplicate sts on the ws of the mitt to help strengthen this area red line shows the gutter of the flap sew several sts then pull the tail to blue line shows the gutter of the palm draw them together 3 pines cont working chart row 4-9 until 2 remain before end of middle finger then work chart row 10-21 palm k all sts matching decreases to the pines side as indicated below decrease pines small row 13 p2tog cont chart p2tog top medium row 12 ssk cont chart k2tog large row 11 k1 ssk cont chart k2tog k1 palm small and medium ssk k to last 2 sts k2tog large k1 ssk k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 cont decrease until 8 4 per side sts remain cut yarn leaving a 12 tail run through remaining sts to close pick up 16 thumb sts plus 2 sts from the body above the thumb opening position sts on two or three needles so that there are 8 sts on the pines side and the picked up sts are on the same needle as the palm sts leaving a 12 tail knit 5 6 7 rnds on the next round place a removeable stitch marker on the yarn bar thumb before and after the pines sts this will mark the point where the thumb flap will eventually be attached knit 3 more rnds above the markers on the next round pines k all sts palm *p2 k2 repeat from * p2 repeat for a total of 4 rnds on the next round pines k all sts palm bind off in pattern pass the yarn ball through the last st to lock it but do not cut yarn pines k all sts set mitts aside using the other end of the yarn from the skein co 12 sts using gtco onto a dpn make sure you have at least a 12 tail from the cast on row 1 ws k3 p2 k2 p2 k3 row 2 rs p3 k2 p2 k2 p3 row 3-4 repeat row 1 and 2 row 5 p all sts row 6 k all sts thumb row 7 p all sts cut yarn leaving 12 tail flap lay
